name: Clarion Collection Hotel Skagen Brygge

reviews.title: best business stop over
reviews.text: Have stayed in Skagen Brygge Hotell over many, many months on business and for friendliness of staff and convenience it can't be beaten! No restaurant is attached to the hotel but then its not necessary due to the perfect location downtown on the quayside - the choice of local restaurants within 5 minutes is staggering (and a bit of 'staggering' was done getting back from the numerous pubs/bars!)Recommended always Nick

reviews.title: An hotel with lots of character
reviews.text: This hotel has so much to commend it that it is difficult to know where to start. The hotel is in a superb location overlooking the harbour which has a fascinating variety of sea-going vessels. An architectural gem, the rooms in the Skagen Brygge are spacious and fairly well appointed and the staff could not be more friendly or helpful. The lobby bar can get fairly busy but service from the well trained staff is swift, polite and efficient. Breakfast is as light or as substantial as you want it to be and there is plenty of variety in the fare on offer.
If there is a downside to the hotel it is that at the weekend the harbour area is very busy and the street noise goes on quite late in summer - it leaves one little choice but to join the party!
reviews.title: Loved the view from this hotel
Nice hotel, shame about the noise
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in mid June and delighted in the fabulous views from our windows of a working harbor. The staff was terrific and went out of their way to help us navigate the city. The rooms are not large by US standards, but are very well kept and attractive. The hotel is near the ferry depot, so it was easy for us to take the catamaran to Bergen, a pleasant four hour trip up the Coast. Parking is expensive, and the city is very accessible, so I would suggest dropping your car off before checking in here.

reviews.title: Made my stay a pleasure
reviews.text: Superb location and gorgeously photogenic from the outside. Pleasant room, and the hotel has some nice design features (such as a nice small coffee lounge on the fourth floor, open to all guests). Decent breakfast. And (the big downside) a bar open until 1am with music so loud that the whole of the hotel seemed to shake, and a total lack of interest from the hotel staff for the disturbance ("Well the bar does get noisy some nights").

reviews.title: A friendly hotel in the center of it all
reviews.text: I can honestly say that this is an excellent hotel. I have stayed in many hotels while travelling but few with such friendly and helpful staff as this. I had to stay for many weeks between June and October this year and my long stay away from home was made more comfortable by the way in which everything in the hotel was dealt with. The connection to the local restaurants is an added bonus making eating out easy and enjoyable. Even after such a long stay I look forward to returning sometime in the future to sample some more Norwegian hospitality.

description: Välkommen till Hotel Skagen Brygge, en unik hotellpärla i centrala Stavanger. Hos oss bor du precis vid kajkanten med en idyllisk utsikt över hamnen. Och för dig som önskar, står både eftermiddagsfika och kvällsmat framdukat. Det bjuder vi på!
